wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Repertorio offers a variety of productions available for touring across New York City and beyond. Our production list includes classic and contemporary pieces as well as musicals and theater for children. Some of our most popular and requested touring productions are La gringa, En el tiempo de las mariposas, Bsame mucho, El Quijote, and La casa de Bernarda Alba.
BOOK A TOUR BY CALLING OR EMAILING US 212.225.9999 or tours@repetorio.org

UPCOMING TOURS

SEPTEMBER 25-26, 2015

"La zapatera prodigiosa" by Federico Garca Lorca International Theatre Festival - Cuenca, Ecuador Made possible by Theatre Communications Group, The Andrew W. Mellon Foundation, and Robert Sterling Clark Foundation

OCTOBER 16, 2015

"Bsame Mucho: Latinas Sing Latinas" by Pablo Zinger Guaracini Performing Arts Center at Cumberland County College - Vineland, NJ

NOVEMBER 12, 2015

"El Quijote" by Miguel de Cervantes Roschel Performing Arts Center at Franklin Marshall College - Lancaster, PA

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
DIGNIDAD!

The Spanish word dignidad can be translated as both pride and self-esteem. Both meanings drive Repertorios education efforts. Since its beginning, Repertorio Espaol has committed its resources to making theatre accessible and part of the classroom experience with the aim of instilling cultural pride, promoting self-awareness, and divulging the riches of Spanish-language theatre.  

EDUCATION OUTREACH

  • Share the excitement of the theatre with students
  • Introduce students to their theatrical cultural heritage
  • Challenge the lack of knowledge that exists about Latino culture
  • Create a generation of future dramatists, theatre artists, administrators & theatre-goers

Through Dignidad! what we hope to accomplish is to create the next generation of theatergoers, or better still, the next generation of theatre artists with a love and respect for live theatre. Ren Buch, Repertorio Espaols Founding Artistic Director

MATINEE SCHOOL DAY PERFORMANCES

Repertorio provides weekday matinees at 11:00 am & 1:00 pm. These are accompanied by pre-performance lectures and post-performance Q&A periods. Teachers may join our mailing list in order to receive school newsletters with advance schedules. Teachers can also take a glimpse at available productions before making a reservation.

Professional teaching artists lead these residencies. They are working playwrights and actors with previous teaching experience at all levels. In partnership with classroom teachers and school administrators, we create a series of sequential lessons designed to enhance classroom assignments as well as expand the students creativity and emotional expression. These lessons follow the New York City Blueprint for teaching the Performing Arts, the New York State Learning Standards and will address the new Common Core Curriculum.
Workshops are taught in English and/or Spanish, and often reach students who ordinarily would not have the opportunity to actively participate in theatre. This exposure builds on their literacy skills, critical and analytical thinking as well as their self-awareness, self-expression and overall creativityskills that can translate into other academic subjects and their personal lives.
Students will learn acting techniques and the craft of playwriting and are required to create fully developed original monologues, group scenes or an adaptation based on an established text. Long-term residencies have a culminating event at Repertorio, using our sound system, lights, costumes and props in front of an audience of their peers, teachers and parents.
<iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/63399558" width="500" height="281" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe>

GROUP SALES

Are you interested in bringing a group of 10 or more students to one of our productions? Repertorio offers reduced ticket prices to school groups thanks to the support from our generous sponsors. Please contact us to inquire about school group tickets. 212.225.9999
Teachers may see a production in advance with a pair of free tickets in order to determine whether it is appropriate for their students.
Repertorio offers schools an opportunity to have a performance in their own building. Contact tours@repetorio.org for additional information.

Prepared by education professionals and available free-of-charge on our website, these guides serve as tools for teachers to prepare their students before a performance and to integrate the theater experience into their classroom.

Our Simultext Captioning System offers subtitles in English and Spanish through video screens installed in every seat. If you require translation, please contact us while making your reservation to confirm availability.
The Company offers FOUR student contests
These activities expand and deepen the live theatre experience. There are cash prizes in every category. Winners are also listed in the school newsletter.

Professional teaching artists lead these residencies. They are working playwrights and actors with previous teaching experience at all levels. In partnership with classroom teachers and school administrators, we create a series of sequential lessons designed to enhance classroom assignments as well as expand the students creativity and emotional expression. These lessons follow the New York City Blueprint for teaching the Performing Arts, the New York State Learning Standards and will address the new Common Core Curriculum.

Workshops are taught in English and/or Spanish, and often reach students who ordinarily would not have the opportunity to actively participate in theatre. This exposure builds on their literacy skills, critical and analytical thinking as well as their self-awareness, self-expression and overall creativity skills that can translate into other academic subjects and their personal lives.

Students will learn acting techniques and the craft of playwriting and are required to create fully developed original monologues, group scenes or an adaptation based on an established text. Long-term residencies have a culminating event at Repertorio, using our sound system, lights, costumes and props in front of an audience of their peers, teachers and parents.

<iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/63399558" width="660" height="371" frameborder="0" title="¡DIGNIDAD! (English) Repertorio's Education Program" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe>

item.title: Gramercy Arts Theatre
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Content in this field will be ignored. Please use the fields below

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The historic Gramercy Arts Theatre began its existence as a residential townhouse in the middle of the 19th century. By 1900, it had become a meeting hall and served as an Armenian Church. In 1915 when the theater district was nearby with the original Madison Square Garden and the Hippodrome just down the block on Madison Avenue, actor, playwright and producer Butler Davenport converted the space into a theatre named the Bramhall Theatre. Years later, he renamed the theatre after himself, The Davenport Free Theater, to house his theater company which functioned solely on the voluntary donations of audiences as opposed to an admission. A firm believer of accessibility to the arts, he once stated that I have dedicated my life to spreading the idea that nobody should pay for theater admissions. We have free schools, free art museums, free symphony concerts and libraries, why not free theaters?

Mayor Fiorello LaGuardia, while riding on a firetruck to a fire, saw the theatre, recognized its unique free admission and declared The Davenport, New York's oldest Off-Broadway Theater. The Davenport Free Theater functioned as a repertory theater until Mr. Davenport's death in the 1950's. The building was bought by Robinson Callen, a Korean War veteran, who renamed it, the Gramercy Arts Theatre and rented out the theatre to commercial producers. In 1961, Barbra Streisand sang here in the musical revue, Another Evening with Harry Stoones which closed on opening night.
By 1972, the space was serving as a children's theatre when it caught the eye of Repertorio Espaols founders, Ren Buch and Gilberto Zaldvar, as the perfect home for their young, four year old theater company. Repertorio continues to occupy and maintain the historic building today making it wheelchair accessible and perpetually assuring that the theater has state-of-the-art technology, including its Simultext Captioning System that provides translation to each individual audience member.

DIGNIDAD!

Dignidad! significa orgullo pero tambin significa autoestima y autovaloracin. Estos significados establecen la direccin de nuestro programa educacional. Desde sus comienzos, Repertorio Espaol ha comprometido sus esfuerzos a lograr que el teatro sea accesible a los estudiantes y se convierta en una herramienta de enseanza en el saln de clase. La meta es fomentar un sentido de orgullo cultural y de divulgar las riquezas del teatro latinoamericano y espaol.

ALCANCE EDUCACIONAL

  • Compartir la emocin del teatro con los estudiantes
  • Introducir a los estudiantes a las riquezas teatrales de su propia cultura
  • Compensar la falta de conocimiento que existe acerca de la cultura Hispanoamericana
  • Desarrollar una generacin joven de dramaturgos, artistas teatrales, administradores y pblico teatral
Nuestra meta para Dignidad! es desarrollar el pblico teatral del futuro y una nueva generacin de artistas teatrales apasionados. - Ren Buch, Director Artstico Fundador

FUNCIONES ESCOLARES DE MATIN

Repertorio provee funciones los das de semana a las 11am y 1pm. Las funciones son precedidas con una charla acerca de la produccin y seguidas de una sesin de preguntas y respuestas. Los maestros pueden unirse a nuestra lista de correo para recibir un calendario de funciones con anticipacin. Los maestros tambin pueden echar un vistazo a las producciones disponibles antes de hacer una reservacin.

Nuestras residencias artsticas estn encabezadas por artistas profesionalesescritores y actorescon experiencia en el mundo de la enseanza. Creamos una serie de lecciones diseadas en colaboracin con maestros y administradores para realzar el trabajo hecho en clase. Con esto en mente, ayudamos a desarrollar la creatividad y expresin emocional de los estudiantes. Estas lecciones estn creadas de acuerdo con los Estndares Bsicos Comunes de Aprendizaje de Nueva York, el plan de accin para la enseanza de las artes escnicas en la ciudad de Nueva York (the New York City Blueprint for teaching the Performing Arts) y el nuevo currculo comn.
Los talleres se ensean en ingls y/o espaol, y es comn que los estudiantes participantes no hayan tenido la oportunidad de participar en actividades teatrales previamente. Los talleres desarrollan las destrezas de lectura y escritura de los estudiantes, y expanden sus habilidades tanto analticas como crticas, al igual que su creatividad, conciencia de s y de otros a su alrededor. Estas destrezas tambin influyen el aprovechamiento de otras materias acadmicas.
Los estudiantes aprendern tcnicas de actuacin y dramaturgia y crearn monlogos originales, escenas grupales o una adaptacin de un texto conocido. Estas residencias educativas culminan en una presentacin en el teatro de Repertorio para el disfrute de sus compaeros, maestros y padres.

VENTAS DE GRUPOS

Est usted interesado en traer un grupo de 10 o ms estudiantes a una de nuestras producciones? Repertorio ofrece entradas reducidas para grupos escolares gracias al apoyo de nuestros generosos patrocinadores. Contctenos para solicitar informacin sobre grupos escolares. 212.225.9999
BOLETOS DE PRUEBA GRATUITOS PARA MAESTROS
Los maestros pueden ver nuestras funciones con anticipacin con un par de boletos gratuitos para determinar si las mismas son apropiadas para su grupo de estudiantes.

Repertorio ofrece la oportunidad a escuelas de presentar una de nuestras producciones en sus instalaciones. Traduccin simultnea tambin se ofrece para giras. Enve un e-mail a tours@repertorio.org para informacin adicional.

Preparadas por educadores profesionales y disponibles libre de costo en nuestra pgina web (ver columna derecha de esta pgina para accesar las guas). Las mismas sirven como una herramienta para preparar a los estudiantes antes de visitar el teatro y para aprender acerca del contexto histrico de nuestras obras.
Nuestro nuevo sistema Simultext ofrece subttulos en ingls y espaol a travs de pantallas de video instaladas en la parte posterior de cada asiento en el teatro.
Estas actividades profundizan y amplan la experiencia teatral. Se ofrecen premios en efectivo por cada categora. Los ganadores se anuncian en nuestro boletn anual.

Estas lecciones estn creadas de acuerdo con los Estndares Bsicos Comunes de Aprendizaje de Nueva York, el plan de accin para la enseanza de las artes escnicas en la ciudad de Nueva York (the New York City Blueprint for teaching the Performing Arts) y el nuevo currculo comn.
Los talleres se ensean en ingls y/o espaol, y es comn que los estudiantes participantes no hayan tenido la oportunidad de participar en actividades teatrales previamente. Los talleres desarrollan las destrezas de lectura y escritura de los estudiantes, y expanden sus habilidades tanto analticas como crticas, al igual que su creatividad, conciencia de s y de otros a su alrededor. Estas destrezas tambin influyen el aprovechamiento de otras materias acadmicas.
Los estudiantes aprendern tcnicas de actuacin y dramaturgia y crearn monlogos originales, escenas grupales o una adaptacin de un texto conocido. Estas residencias educativas culminan en una presentacin en el teatro de Repertorio para el disfrute de sus compaeros, maestros y padres.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: For 47 years Repertorio Espaol has been presenting the best of Spanish language theater in New York City. This milestone could not have been reached without the generous financial support of individuals just like you. Check out our different areas of giving and see where you can make a difference today.
S! YES! I WOULD LIKE TO SUPPORT REPERTORIO

PRODUCTIONS

Repertorio produces up to 5 new productions each season and we need your support to make that happen. Your contribution to one or more of our upcoming productions will go towards things like set design, costumes, and lighting. Become a sponsor of new productions today!

EDUCATION

Did you know your contribution can allow for a child to see a play for the very first time? With your generous contribution to Repertorio's education program Dignidad!, students from across the New York Area can attend a matinee performance with their school for a subsidized rate.

GREATEST NEED

Ticket sales account for only half of Repertorio's operating expenses. Your contribution to our greatest needs goes towards areas such as maintaining our theatre space; hiring new actors, directors, designers and talent; and spreading the word about Repertorio. Help us continue our legacy of excellent Spanish theater.

CAPITAL

Your support towards capital projects allows for Repertorio to plan for the future and keep the theater up to date with technology and building improvements, among others. With your support toward capital projects we can continue to keep Repertorio the #1 Spanish language theater in the nation.

Repertorio ofrece una amplia variedad de producciones disponibles para giras a travs de la ciudad de Nueva York y otras regiones. Nuestra lista de produccin incluye piezas clsicas y contemporneas, as como espectculos musicales y de teatro para nios. Algunas de nuestras producciones en gira ms populares y solicitadas son "La gringa", "En el tiempo de las mariposas," Bsame mucho "," El Quijote "y" La casa de Bernarda Alba ".
LLMENOS O ENVENOS UN CORREO ELECTRNICO PARA RESERVAR UNA GIRA. 212.225.9999 otours@repetorio.org

item.title: Gramercy Arts Theatre
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Copy in this field will be ignored. Please use the fields below

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: El histrico Gramercy Arts Theater fue construido en 1915 como el Davenport Free Theater. El mismo fue fundado por Benjamin Butler Davenport para albergar su compaa de teatro que funcionaba nicamente con donaciones voluntarias del pblico en vez de ellos pagar por la admisin al teatro. Butler, fue un firme creyente de la accesibilidad a las artes, donde declar "He dedicado mi vida a difundir el mensaje de que nadie debe pagar por admisin al teatro. Tenemos escuelas gratuitas, museos de arte gratuitos, conciertos sinfnicos gratuitos y bibliotecas, y por qu teatros no?"

El Davenport Free Theater funcionaba como un teatro de repertorio completo hasta la dcada del 1940, momento donde el cual se alquila como lugar para diversas producciones comerciales. El edificio fue posteriormente comprado por Robinson Callen, un veterano de la Guerra de Corea y en 1971. El espacio haba llamado la atencin de los fundadores de Repertorio Espaol, Ren Buch y Gilberto Zaldvar, como el hogar perfecto para sus producciones, siendo una compaa de teatro de tres aos para ese entonces. Repertorio sigue ocupando hoy da el edificio histrico con la restauracin del proscenio icnico y adems asegurando que el teatro tenga una tecnologa de ltima generacin, incluyendo su sistema de subttulos Simultext que proporciona traduccin de Ingls a cada miembro de la audiencia.

item.title: Opportunities
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Copy in this field will be ignored. Please use the fields below instead.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: There are always ways to get involved at Repertorio. Whether youre a playwright, actor, director, or have experience working for non-profits; Repertorio has something for everyone. Check out some of the various opportunities that are available today!

METLIFE NUESTRAS VOCES NATIONAL PLAYWRITING COMPETITION

Since 2000, MetLife Foundation and Repertorio Espaol joined forces to establish the MetLife Nuestras Voces National Playwriting Competition to discover the best Latino plays and bring them to the attention of the American theatre community. These original works relate to Latino culture, history, and life in the United States while at the same time reflecting the universality of the human condition. It has been our privilege to promote and develop new plays and encourage bright new talent by providing this forum.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Playwrights may be Latino or of any other ethnic or racial background as long as the plays subject matter and characters resonate with Latino audiences and accurately depicts the Hispanic experience.
  • No screenplays, one act plays, musicals, adaptations or translations will be accepted.
  • New and un-produced plays preferred. Plays that have had readings or a workshop production are acceptable.
  • All plays must be original and full-length (minimum running time: 1 hr., 30 min) and can be written in Spanish and/or English.
  • Playwrights must be at least 18 years of age and residents of the United States or Puerto Rico.
  • Previously submitted scripts are accepted unless they have already placed in the top 10.

ABOUT THE SPONSOR
MetLife Foundation was established by MetLife to carry on its longstanding tradition of corporate contributions and community involvement. Recognizing the vital role the arts play in building communities, the Foundation contributes to arts by focusing on creating opportunities for young people and reaching broader audiences through inclusive and accessible programming.

EDWARD AND SALLY VAN LIER FELLOWSHIP FOR HISPANIC / LATINO DIRECTORS

This fellowship is designed to give emerging Hispanic Latino directors an opportunity to develop their craft by mounting two professional theater productions at Repertorio Espaol. This Fellowship is sponsored by The New York Community Trust.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Must be Hispanic / Latino and 30 years old or younger.
  • Must live full time in one of the five boroughs of New York City and plan to remain in New York City.
  • Have completed BA or MFA in dramatic arts and must not be currently enrolled in any university or a full time theatre training program.
  • Must be a citizen or permanent resident of the United States.

About the Sponsor
The New York Community Trust is dedicated to meeting the changing needs of children, youth, and families; aid in community development; improve the environment; promote health; assist people with special needs; and support education, arts, and human justice.

AUDITIONING FOR REPERTORIO

Repertorio is constantly looking for professional actors (male and female) fluent in the Spanish language for new productions and substitutions in existing productions.   The Company accepts unsolicited headshots and resumes all year round. Headshots and resumes may be sent to casting@repertorio.org with the phrase Headshot / Resume + Your Name as the subject line. Actors will need to furnish evidence that they are authorized to work in the United State at the moment of employment.   We will keep your headshot and resume on file and will contact you for an audition only when there are new casting needs. Make sure to send updates if there are changes in your contact information and/or resume.

JOB OPPORTUNITIES

Want to join the Repertorio team? Check out our current list of openings for internships and full/part time positions.

There are no openings at this time.

item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Siempre hay maneras de involucrarse en Repertorio. Si usted es dramaturgo, actor, director, o tiene experiencia trabajando para organizaciones sin fines de lucro; Repertorio tiene algo para todos. Echa un vistazo a algunas de las diversas oportunidades que estn disponibles hoy da!

CONCURSO NACIONAL DE OBRAS TEATRALES METLIFE NUESTRAS VOCES

Desde el ao 2000 la Fundacin MetLife y Repertorio Espaol han unido esfuerzos a travs de la Competencia Nacional de Obras Latinas MetLife Nuestras Voces. Dicha competencia tiene como meta dar a conocer las mejores obras escritas por autores hispanos y promoverlas entre la comunidad teatral del pas. Las obras que surgen de la competencia reflejan la condicin humana universal a travs de historias que se relacionan especficamente con la cultura, la historia y las vidas de los latinos que viven en los EE.UU. Ha sido un privilegio para Repertorio Espaol promover y desarrollar nuevas obras teatrales y nuevos dramaturgos a travs de esta iniciativa. CALIFICACIONES
  • No se aceptarn guiones, solamente obras teatrales
  • No se aceptarn obras de un acto, musicales ni traducciones
  • Todas las obras deben ser originales y tener una duracin de al menos una hora y media
  • Se prefieren obras nuevas que no han sido estrenadas; sin embargo, se aceptan obras que han sido ledas en pblico o presentadas en un taller dramtico
  • Las obras pueden ser en espaol o en ingls
  • Los autores deben ser mayores de 18 aos y residentes de EE.UU. o Puerto Rico

SOBRE EL AUSPICIADOR La Fundacin MetLife fue creada por la compaa MetLife para mantener su larga tradicin de contribuciones corporativas y de compromiso con la comunidad. Reconociendo el papel importantsimo que desempean las artes en nuestras comunidades, la Fundacin MetLife contribuye financieramente a diversas organizaciones artsticas y culturales a travs de todo el pas; haciendo hincapi en aumentar las oportunidades para nuestra juventud, llegar al mayor nmero de espectadores por medio de programas diversificados y hacer las artes ms accesibles a toda la poblacin.

BECA VAN LIER

Esta beca est diseada para brindar la oportunidad a directores teatrales Hispanos / Latinos jvenes de desarrollar su destreza y presentar producciones profesionales de dos obras distintas en Repertorio Espaol. Esta beca es posible gracias a fondos provistos por The New York Community Trust. CALIFICACIONES
  • Ser Hispanos / Latinos y no mayores de 30 aos de edad
  • Deben ser residentes de uno de los condados de la Ciudad de Nueva York al momento de solicitar y durante toda la duracin de la beca
  • Deben ser graduados con un Bachillerato (BA) o Maestra (MA & MFA) y no pueden ser estudiantes actuales de una universidad o algn programa de enseanza a tiempo completo
  • Deben ser ciudadanos o residentes permanentes de los EE.UU

SOBRE EL AUSPICIADOR La Fundacin est dedicada a satisfacer las distintas necesidades de los nios, jvenes y familias, ayudar el desarrollo comunitario; mejorar el medio ambiente; promover la buena salud; ayudar a las personas con necesidades especiales, y apoyar la educacin, las artes y la justicia social.

AUDICIONES PARA REPERTORIO

Repertorio siempre est buscando actores (ambos sexos) con fluidez en espaol para nuevas producciones y sustituciones de obras actuales. La compaa acepta fotos (headshots) y currculum todo el ao. Puede enviar los mismos a casting@repertorio.org con la frase Foto y Currculum + Su nombre completo en la lnea de Asunto (Subject). Se requiere que los actores presenten evidencia de que estn autorizados a trabajar en los EE.UU. al momento de recibir una oferta para un personaje. Mantendremos su foto y currculum en nuestros archivos y nos comunicaremos con usted para una audicin slo si surgen nuevas oportunidades en los elencos de nuestras producciones. Asegrese de re-enviar su foto y currculum si cambia la informacin en el mismo o si cambia su informacin de contacto.

OPORTUNIDADES DE EMPLEO

Quieres formar parte de nuestro equipo? Echa un vistazo a nuestra lista actual de plazas para internados, posiciones de tiempo completo y/o parcial.

REPERTORIO ESPANOL

138 East 27th Street, New York, NY 10016 (between Lexington and Third Avenues)

Fax: 212.225.9085

BOX OFFICE HOURS

Mon 9:00 am 6:00 pm

Tues - Fri 9:00 am 7:00 pm

Sat 11:00 am 8:00 pm

Sun 11:00 am - 6:30 pm

CLOSEST STOPS - 28th Street

6, N, R, M34, M16, M23, M102, M103

CLOSEST GARAGES

Icon Parking Systems* Biltmore Plaza 155 E 29th St, New York, NY 10016

*Parking at this location requires validation from Repertorio Espaol for the reduced rate of $15 for 4 hours.

212.684.8259 iconparkingsystems.com

1. Where is Repertorio Espaol located?

Repertorio is located at 138 East 27th Street in Manhattan between Lexington and Third Avenues. The closest MTA stations are located on 28th Street, which include the 6, N, & R trains. If traveling by car from New Jersey, please plan ahead as delays are very common.

2. If Im coming by car, where can I park?

The closest parking garage is Icon Parking located on East 29th Street between Lexington and Third Avenues. Parking must be validated at the theaters box office in order to receive the discounted parking rate of $15 for 4 hours of parking.

3. Are your productions appropriate for children?

Repertorio does not permit anyone under the age of 12 in the theater with the exception of those attending a specified childrens production. Some subject matter may not be suitable for those under 18, so please contact us in advance with any concerns.

4. I cant make the show. Can I change my ticket?

Repertorio does not allow for exchanges or refunds once tickets are purchased. Refunds and exchanges can only be made in the event of a performance cancelation in which you will be notified immediately.

5. What restaurants are close to Repertorio?

Repertorio is located near many restaurants including several West Asian and Middle Eastern style cuisine. Check out Yelp to see a listing of recommended restaurants in our area.

6. Is there translation available for all of your productions?

No. There are some productions where translation is not available. Please contact us when purchasing tickets to inquire if translation is available for your desired performance date.

Contctenos SU NOMBRE SU CORREO ELECTRNICO SELECCIONE ASUNTO DEL MENSAJE MENSAJE

Dnde se encuentra Repertorio Espaol?

Las estaciones de MTA ms cercanas se encuentran en la calle 28, que incluyen los trenes 6, N, y R. Si viaja en coche de Nueva Jersey, por favor planifique con anticipacin ya que los retrasos son muy comunes en esta rea.

Y si voy en carro? Dnde puedo estacionarme?

El estacionamiento ms cercano es el Icon Parking situado en la calle 29 Este entre Lexington y Tercera Avenidas. El boleto de estacionamiento debe ser validado en la taquilla del teatro con el fin de recibir la tarifa de estacionamiento con el descuento de $ 15 por 4 horas de estacionamiento.

Son las producciones apropiadas para nios?

Repertorio no permite la entrada de cualquier persona menor de 12 aos al teatro, con la excepcin de producciones para nios que as lo especifiquen. Algn contenido puede no ser adecuado para menores de 18 aos, favor de contactarnos por adelantado con cualquier preocupacin al respecto.

No puedo llegar al espectculo! Puedo cambiar mi boleto?

Repertorio no permite cambios ni reembolsos una vez que se compran los boletos. Los reembolsos y los cambios slo se pueden hacer en caso de una cancelacin por lo cual se le notificar de inmediato.

Cules restaurantes estn cerca de Repertorio?

Repertorio se encuentra cerca de muchos restaurantes, incluyendo asiticos y del Medio Oriente. Refirase a Yelp para ver la lista de restaurantes recomendados en nuestra zona.

Hay traduccin disponible para todas las producciones?

No. Hay algunas producciones donde la traduccin no est disponible. Contctenos al momento de comprar sus entradas para preguntar si la traduccin est disponible para su fecha deseada.

item.title: 2014-2015 Edward & Sally Van Lier Fellowship for Directors
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Content in this field will be ignored. Use the fields below.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Repertorio Espaol, the nations pre-eminent Spanish language theater, is proud to announce The Edward and Sally Van Lier Fellowship for Directors. This fellowship is designed to give emerging Hispanic Latino directors an opportunity to mount two professional theater productions at Repertorio Espaol. - See more at: http://repertorio.nyc/#/vanlier-apply

Candidates must meet all of the following requirements:

  1. Be Hispanic / Latino and 30 years old or younger;
  2. Must live full time in one of the five boroughs of New York City and plan to remain in New York City;
  3. Have completed BA or MFA in dramatic arts and must not be currently enrolled in any university or a full time theatre training program;
  4. Must be citizens or permanent residents of the United States

The ideal fellows will have some previous experience in directing, an integral knowledge of classical Spanish theatre, contemporary Latin American theatre as well as a familiarity of Hispanic-American playwrights.

Three directors will be chosen to participate based on production proposals and in-person interviews. Fellows will direct 2 distinct works in Spanish over the course of two summers.

  1. The first round of productions will be contemporary works written in Spanish or works by Hispanic American playwrights which will happen in the summer of 2014.
  2. The second round will be plays from the Siglo de Oro (Spains Golden Age) which will happen in the summer of 2015.

Must follow instructions and fully fill out form to participate. Unfortunately, we cannot accept any changes or re-submissions once the information has been submitted.

Deadline: Monday, March 15, 2014

  1. Artistic rsum with two references
  2. Short Biography (200 word maximum)
  3. A one-page long project description, in Spanish, for each of the proposed projects: one contemporary (Spain, Latin America, USA Latino) and one classical (Siglo de Oro) work.
  4. Proof of age and residency
Please direct any questions regarding this fellowship/application to vanlier@repertorio.org

item.title: MetLife Nuestras Voces National Playwriting Competition 2015
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Content in this field will be ignored. Please us the fields below.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
Plays that do not meet these requirements will not be considered (please read carefully).
  1. Playwrights may be Latino or of any other ethnic or racial background as long as the play's subject matter and characters resonate with Latino audiences and accurately depict the Hispanic experience.
  2. No screenplays, one act plays, musicals, adaptations or translations will be accepted.
  3. New and un-produced plays preferred. Plays that have had readings or a workshop production are acceptable.
  4. All plays must be original and full-length (minimum running time: 1 hr., 30 min) and can be written in Spanish and/or English.
  5. Playwrights must be at least 18 years of age and residents of the United States or Puerto Rico.
  6. Previously submitted scripts are accepted unless they have already placed in the top 10.

1. Each script will be read by two qualified independent judges selected by Repertorio Espaol, on a blind submission.
  2. Winners will be announced six to seven months after the deadline.
  3. Each participant will be notified of the results by e-mail. We request that participants do not contact the office to inquire about the competitions results.

Round 1: Finalists will receive a staged reading at Repertorio to further develop the script.

Round 2:

Grand Prize Winner: $3,000 and a full production at Repertorio Espaol (must be available for Awards Ceremony)

2nd Place: $2,000

3rd Place: $1,000

Must follow instructions and fully fill out form to participate. Unfortunately, we cannot accept any changes or re-submissions once the script has been submitted. Do not send any other biographical infomation or reviews.

Deadline: Monday, June 1st, 2015

  1. One ELECTRONIC COPY of your script -- in one document with numbered pages and a title page that lists the title and year the play was written ONLY. (PDF, Microsoft Word, Plain or Rich Text Formats Accepted)
  2. Please OMIT your name from the script
  3. Do not send other biographical information or reviews
  4. Unfortunately, we cannot accept any changes or re-submissions once the script has been submitted.

By submitting your play to the competition, Repertorio Espaol shall have a right to produce the play for a period of two years. Such production shall be done in accordance with an agreement acceptable to both the playwright and Repertorio Espaol. If the playwright receives an offer within the two year period from a third party to produce the play, the company has the right to decide to produce the play on terms no less favorable than offered. Please direct any questions regarding this competition/application to nuestrasvoces@repertorio.org

For the true Repertorio fan, our Comboticket Subscriptions are just what youve been looking for. Discounted tickets, priority seating, and exclusive access to new productions are just some of the many perks included.
The more, the merrier. Repertorio offers discounted rates to groups of 10 or more to many of our various productions. Choose your performance and contact us for availability and special pricing.

Dont know what to get your friend or family member for that special occasion? Give them the gift of theater! With various amounts to choose from, tickets to Repertorio make the perfect gift for a fabulous night of pure entertainment.

Did you know Repertorio is wheelchair accessible, offers an audio amplification system for the hard of hearing, and offers visual captions in English and Spanish? Please contact us for pricing and seating if you request any of these accessibility options.

item.title: HIERBA MALA NUNCA MUERE
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Premium seats available. Running time: 1 hr 15 min. No intermission. Photo by Michael Palma. Recommended for adult audiences The hysterical, critically acclaimed comedy that follows the adventures of a dictator well past his prime and those sent to kill him off. The old bird is understandably confused. When he was a boy, Havana was sometimes called the Paris of the Caribbean. He thought he had put an end to that capitalist decadence, but now that hes in his late 80s, some guy is suddenly trying to open Cuba back up again. And the guy is black. The New York Time

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: By Juan Claudio Lechn |Directed by Leyma Lpez

The hysterical, critically acclaimed comedy that follows the adventures of a dictator well past his prime and those sent to kill him off.

By Juan Claudio Lechn |Directed by Leyma Lpez

item.title: EN LA USA ME QUED
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Premium seats available. Photo by Jaime Rosas. Recommended for adult audiences The latest one-man-show by Spanish language comedian, Saulo Garca. A new and hilarious stand-up comedy by the same gifted comedian who made us laugh uncontrollably with La vida en los Esclavos Unidos and El insomnia americano. En la USA me qued is a non-stop over the top comedy about the life of immigrants who decide to stay in the USA searching for the American Dream which will ultimately come true for their children. Performed in Spanish only. No English translation available.

item.title: LA ZAPATERA PRODIGIOSA
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Premium seats available. Running time: 1 hr 30 min. No intermission. Photo by Michael Palma. Recommended for all audiences Gossip and ageism nip at the marriage of a mismatched couple in Federico Garca Lorcas rarely produced comedy. A humorous, but thoughtful look at the antagonistic relationship between a young wife and her 53 year-old shoemaker husband [] It doesnt help that the towns gossips are always sniping at her, or that the mayor is making advances, all rendered in a comic style[.] So when her husband makes a radical decision that will change their lives, shes forced to rely on her wits. The Huffington Post

item.title: LA NENA SE CASA
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Premium seats available. Running time: 1 hr 30 min. Intermission: 15 min. Photos by Michael Palma. Recommended for all audiences An over-the-top comedy about the whims and pretentions of a family desperate to climb the social ladder. La nena se casa is a rip-roaring look at Puerto Rican idiosyncrasies while highlighting deeply universal themes. LatinTRENDS Performed in Spanish with subtitles in English & Spanish via Simultext In-Seat Captioning System.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: By Carlos Ferrari |Directed by Jos Zayas

item.title: EL AMOR EN LOS TIEMPOS DEL CLERA
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Premium seats available. Running time: 2 hr. Intermission: 10 min. Photos by Michael Palma. Recommended for all audiences
Gabriel Garca Mrquezs epic tale in which a secret love must stand the test of time.
Fifty-one years, nine months and four days I have waited for you, Florentino Ariza tells Fermina Daza when he arrives after her husbands death, approaching her with the faltering steps of age Mr. Garca Mrquez describes in his book. Their interrupted courtship bookends the narrative, which is set, Ms. Svichs script informs us, in the present, past and future. The New York Times

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: By Caridad Svich | Directed by Jos Zayas

item.title: AIRE FRO
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Premium seats available. Running time: 2 hr 30 min. Intermission: 15 min. Photo by Michael Palma. Recommended for all audiences An on-stage masterpiece that brings to life a struggling, tight knit family in pre-revolutionary Cuba. "I'm going to marry the first man I find in the street!" yells Luz Marina, the protagonist of Virgilio Piera's greatest play, Aire fro. A strong -willed fighter bent on survival in a harsh world of male chauvinism, necessity and political turmoil, she will toil to keep her family together while chasing her own humble dream of finding a husband.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: By Virgilio Piera |Directed by Leyma Lpez

item.title: CITA A CIEGAS
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Premium seats available. Running time: 2 hr. No intermission. Photos by Michael Palma. Recommended for adult audiences
An on-stage thriller that dives deep into a twisted world of encounters, passion and murder.
Performed around the world to enthusiastic critical and audience acclaim, Cita a ciegas is a compelling and riveting play about chance encounters. An intricate puzzle of passions, destinies, and coincidences seduces audiences into a world filled with unrequited love, dangerous obsessions, and the thought of what-might-have-been.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: By Mario Diament |Directed by Jorge Al Triana

item.title: EN EL TIEMPO DE LAS MARIPOSAS
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Premium seats available. Running time: 1 hr 40 min. No intermission. Photo by Michael Palma. Recommended for all audiences
The Mirabal sisters stood up to one of historys most notorious dictators, and this on-stage adaptation brings these national heroines back to life.
The outrage and sorrow that greeted the murder of the three elegant and revolutionary Mirabal sisters in the Dominican Republic during the homicidal dictatorship of General Rafael Trujillo have never really ended. These emotions are evident [] and is the subject of In the Time of the Butterflies. [] it largely does justice to this story of injustice. Backstage

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: By Carmen Rivera | Directed by Ren Buch

item.title: LA GRINGA
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Premium seats available. Running time: 2 hr. Intermission: 10 min. Photo by Michael Palma. Recommended for all audiences
Carmen Riveras iconic play that captures the spirit of the Puerto Rican experience.
La gringa is the story of a young woman from New York who goes to Puerto Rico in search of her extended family. When she finds them, the complicated misperceptions that develop on all sides unfold in comic dialogue that arouses constant shouts of laughter and bursts of applause [] The New York Times

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: By Carmen Rivera | Directed by Ren Buch

item.title: CRNICA DE UNA MUERTE ANUNCIADA
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Premium seats available. Running time: 1 hr 10 min. Photo by Michael Palma. Recommended for adult audiences
A journey to the Colombia of Gabriel Garca Mrquez that explores the grisly murder of an innocent man and the guilt of an entire village.
[Crnica de una muerte anunciada] was based on an actual murder that came to fascinate journalists bent on interviewing the crime's plethora of colorful witnesses. Bogot-based director Jorge Al Triana who adapted the work deploys an array of relatives, friends, and townspeople struggling to explain how the Vicario twins killed Santiago Nasar for deflowering their sister, Angela. The flashbacks and mesmerizing chatter elicit the same gallows humor that festers in newsrooms from New York to Tierra del Fuego, and the absurdity of crimes of passion is laid bare. The Village Voice

item.title: LA CASA DE BERNARDA ALBA
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Premium seats available. Running time: 1 hr 30 min. No intermission. Photo by Michael Palma. Recommended for all audiences
Federico Garca Lorcas prolific tragedy that unfolds in a cloistered world of women in 1930s Spain.
Hatred, jealousy and despair come to life, almost as characters in their own right, in the Repertorio Espaols Spanish-language production of La casa de Bernarda Alba. [] Garca Lorcas grim satisfaction in exposing the pretensions, self-deceits and destructive willfulness of Bernarda Alba and her five daughters in a world of women who are all victims is almost palpable. The New York Times

item.title: EL QUIJOTE
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Photo by Michael Palma Running time: 1 hour and 40 minutes. No intermission Group rates available VIP Seats Available Recommended for all audiences
An adaptation of Miguel de Cervantes epic novel that follows the misadventures of Don Quijote and his loyal squire, Sancho Panza.
El Quijote stresses the absurdities of Don Quijotes quest, as he attempts to right wrongs and rescue damsels in distress [] Don Quijote and Sancho stumble through a series of adventures (or misadventures, as Sancho calls them). Company members never falter, never miss a step. At the same time, the directors creativity is unbounded. Backstage

item.title: DOA FLOR Y SUS DOS MARIDOS
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Premium seats available. Running time: 1 hr 40 min. Intermission: 15 min. Photo by Michael Palma. Recommended for adult audiences A bawdy farce in the streets of Baha, Brazil brought to life with soap-opera star Francisco Gattorno. This adaptation of Jorge Amados Brazilian novel [] is a sex farce with the clarity and logic of a folk tale. [] The widow Flor marries Teodoro, a staid pharmacist, only to have her philandering, gambling bad-boy of a first husband, Vadinho, return from the dead. The New York Times

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: By Jorge Amado | Directed by Jorge Al Triana

item.title: BSAME MUCHO: LATINAS SING LATINAS
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Premium seats available. Running time: 1 hr 40 min. Intermission: 15 min. Photo by Michael Palma. Recommended for all audiences A musical review of the musical contributions of Latina composers to the music of Latin America. A new concert celebrating the musical contributions of female Latin American composers Mara Grever (Jrame, Alma ma); Consuelo Velzquez (Bsame mucho, Cachito); Violeta Parra (Gracias a la vida); Chabuca Granda (Fina estampa, La flor de la canela); Margarita Lecuona (Babal); Isolina Carrillo (Dos gardenias para ti); Mara Elena Walsh (Manuelita la tortuga); Sylvia Rexach (Olas y arena, Di corazn) and many more; performed by extraordinary singers with live music. Performed in Spanish with English subtitles via Simultext In-Seat Captioning System.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Musical Direction by Pablo Zinger | Stage Direction by Jos Zayas

item.title: OLGA PERICET: FLAMENCO SIN TTULO
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Tickets start at $35. Premium seats available. Photo by Michael Palma Recommended for adult audiences A powerhouse performance by the rising international star of Flamenco dance, Olga Pericet. Who is Olga Pericet? In Flamenco sin ttulo (Flamenco Untitled), at Repertorio Espaol, the answer keeps changing. Joined by three other performers the guitarist Antonia Jimnez and the singers Jos ngel Carmona and Ismael Fernndez on the Repertorios small stage, Ms. Pericet, a compact powerhouse of a dancer, passes through many moods and modes of performance. Siobhan Burke, The New York Times MASTER CLASSES BY OLGA PERICET Monday, November 9, 2015 7:00 PM to 9:00 PM Total cost of $100 plus $3 service fee.

item.title: EL BURLADOR DE SEVILLA
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Follow the original womanizer Don Juan and his confidant Catalinn as they skirt their way through adventure, trickery, and women. Performed in Spanish with subtitles in English & Spanish via Simultext In-Seat Captioning System

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: By Tirso de Molina |Directed by Victoria Collado

item.title: LA GRAN SEMRAMIS
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: In her search for absolute power, Queen Semramis will awake a web of passions, secrets and betrayals which she will use as weapons in order to challenge the wheel of fortune. Discover this almost unknown theatrical gem, one of the pioneers of the horror genre from the Spanish Golden Age and performed for the first time in the American stage. Performed in Spanish with subtitles in English & Spanish via Simultext In-Seat Captioning System.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: By Cristbal de Virus | Directed by Diego M. Chiri

item.title: MIMI LAZO: A MI GORDO NO ME LO QUITA NADIE
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Premium seats available. Recommended for adult audiences A new stand-up comedy show by Mim Lazo. Marta is determined to do what it takes to protect her marriage, along with the comfortable social status that goes with it. Along with her overbearing mother whose beliefs are from another era, she will go to any length to make sure she remains lady of the house. Performed in Spanish only. No English translation available.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Directed by Luis Fernndez | Starring Mim Lazo
